greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: 1 followed by A027760, a variant of Bernoulli number denominators.
comment: The denominators of the Bernoulli numbers for n>0. B_n sequence begins 1, -1/2, 1/6, 0/2, -1/30, 0/2, 1/42, 0/2, ... This is an alternative version of A027642 suggested by the theorem of Clausen. - _Peter Luschny_, Apr 29 2009
Let f(n,k) = gcd { multinomial(n; n1, ..., nk) | n1 + ... + nk = n }; then a(n) = f(N,N-n+1)/f(N,N-n) for N >> n. - _Mamuka Jibladze_, Mar 07 2017
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10080
Thomas Clausen, Lehrsatz aus einer Abhandlung Über die Bernoullischen Zahlen, Astr. Nachr. 17 (22) (1840), 351-352.
formula: a(n) are the denominators of the polynomials generated by cosh(x*z)*z/(1-exp(-z)) evaluated x=1. See A176328 for the numerators. - _Peter Luschny_, Aug 18 2018
example: The rational values as given by the e.g.f. in the formula section start: 1, 1/2, 7/6, 3/2, 59/30, 5/2, 127/42, 7/2, 119/30, ... - _Peter Luschny_, Aug 18 2018
maple: if n = 0 then 1 else A027760(n) end if;
mathematica: a[n_] := Sum[ Boole[ PrimeQ[d+1]] / (d+1), {d, Divisors[n]}] // Denominator; Table[a[n], {n, 0, 70}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Aug 09 2012 *)
results.author: _Paul Curtz_, Aug 01 2008
